edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler

  • public class WolfScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class named WolfScheduler is to read in and store as a list all of the Course records stored in a file. Additionally, WolfScheduler creates a schedule for the user and provides functionality for naming the schedule, adding a Course to the schedule, removing a Course from the schedule, resetting the schedule.
    Author:
    Zhongxiao Mei

    • Constructor Detail

      • WolfScheduler

        public WolfScheduler(java.lang.String courseRecordsFileName)
        Initializes schedule to an empty ArrayList and sets title to My Schedule. Initializes the catalog ArrayList and populates the Courses in the catalog from the information in the courseRecordsFileName. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the file cannot be found
        Parameters:
        courseRecordsFileName - the fileName of the input file

    • Method Detail

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Uses the name and section to find a Course in the catalog. Returns null if the Course cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        section - the section number
        Returns:
        the course from catalog

        public boolean addCourse(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String section)

        Parameters:
        name - the name
        section - the section number
        Returns:
        return true if can be added, otherwise return false

        Parameters:
        eventTitle - the title of event
        eventMeetingDays - the meeting days of event
        eventStartTime - the start time of event
        eventEndTime - the end time of event

        eventDetails - the details of event

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets the schedule to an empty ArrayList

      • getCourseCatalog

        public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
        Returns a String[][] that contains a catalog item on each row. The first column is the Course name, the second is the section, and the third is the title.
        Returns:
        a String[][] that contains a catalog item on each row

      • getScheduledActivities

        public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledActivities()
        Returns a String[][] that contains a schedule item on each row. The first column is the Course name, the second is the section, and the third is the title.
        Returns:
        Returns a String[][] that contains a schedule item on each row

      • getFullScheduledActivities

        public java.lang.String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
        Returns a String[][] that contains a schedule item on each row. The first column is the Course name, the second is the section, the third is the title, the fourth is the credits, the fifth is the instructorId, and the sixth is the meeting time String.
        Returns:
        Returns a String[][] that contains a schedule item on each row.
